page.title: 01Hascombe & area to the east
page.content: This is a prosperous farming area with much woodland & beautiful countryside. There is evidence of field sports particularly pheasant shooting & horse riding. The small village of Hasombe lies to the west of the area below Hascombe hill, where a herd of white deer graze. Haxcombe vineyard is on the southerly slopes of the hill. In the south east corner is Nanhurst - a large house which is owned by BUPA and run as a boarding school for children from five to fifteen years old with learning difficulties. Smithbrook kilns on the A281, disused brick works, have recently been developed into craft centres and tight industrial works with a teashop.
